intro: Acetosella squarrosa, commonly known as the woolly mouse-ear, is a low-growing perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its hairy, grayish-green foliage and small, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges, rocky areas, and open heaths. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it an interesting subject for botanical study. It is also valued in horticulture for its ornamental qualities and ability to attract pollinators.
